Articles.Content:
OK KSP I AM TRIED OF THIS PROPLEM THAT DOESNT LET ME PLAY MI GAME THIS IS THE PROPLEM

 

 

 

 

THE VERIFYING IS SOO STUPID I BEEN WAITING AND WAITING AND EVEN TRY AGAIN AND THIS STILL HAPPEN THIS NEED TO STOP OR I CANT PLAY KSP FOREVER

Edited December 11, 2019 by Jebihean Kerman

That does sound bad. But perhaps you could be more specific about the nature of the problem? Is the game loading slowly? Or not at all? Or what? 

Also, thread moved to the support subforum.

It is extremely likely that the expansions are not causing this, but whatever is supposed to happen AFTER them is.

It is also extremely likely that either you have too many mods or one of them is causing the problem.

Well...... we can't help you unless you do a bit of work yourself.....

We need logs and a mod list.    We also need you to confirm that every mod you are using is the right version for the version of KSP you are using.
why not try to delete mechjeb2 or kspwheel?

Putting on the moderator hat for a moment:  Some content has been removed.  Folks, let's please try to confine our discussion to the problem at hand, and not speculate off-topic about people who are posting here.

 

18 hours ago, Jebihean Kerman said:

THE VERIFYING IS SOO STUPID I BEEN WAITING AND WAITING AND EVEN TRY AGAIN AND THIS STILL HAPPEN THIS NEED TO STOP OR I CANT PLAY KSP FOREVER

The issue is probably yours, not KSP's.  3832 ModuleManager patches is a lot-- you're clearly heavily modded.  And the overwhelming likelihood is that this has nothing to do with KSP itself, and that one or more of your mods is causing this problem, either because there's a bug in the mod somewhere, or because you're running an incompatible version of it, or you might not have installed correctly, or such-like.

So, yelling about it isn't super helpful and is unlikely to get traction here.    Main thing is to focus on figuring out what you've done that's causing the problem, and then address that.

Here is what you should do:

  1. Try running KSP unmodded.  The stock game, with no mods at all.  Does it start up?  Or does it refuse to start and you have this problem?
  2. If starting up the stock, unmodded game runs into problems, then you should post an issue about that over in the "tech support for unmodded installs" forum, with screenshots / logs /whatever from your unmodded game.
  3. On the other hand, if (as seems much more likely) it starts up fine when unmodded, then the problem is with one or more of your mods.
  4. In that case, what you should do is use process of elimination to figure out which mod it is, and then go post your issue in the thread for that mod.
Also, posting a complete log file can allow us to look at it , there is always a possibility that someone might see the problem and know the answer
no worry guys i finally was able to fix this proplem
